Generation VII.Sun: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
Generation VII.Moon: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.

Generation VIII.Sword: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
Generation VIII.Shield: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Dewpider uses sticky threads to create the water bubble that covers its head, so the bubble very rarely bursts.
Generation IX.Violet: It supports the water bubble that envelops its head with three of its legs. Sometimes it secretly swaps which legs are holding up the bubble.

Generation VII.Sun: Brooklet Hill Day ( Surfing and walking)
Generation VII.Moon: Brooklet Hill Day ( Surfing and walking)
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Brooklet Hill Day ( Surfing and walking)
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Brooklet Hill Day ( Surfing and walking)

Generation VIII.Sword: Route 5 , Motostoke Riverbank , Stony Wilderness Rolling Fields , Dappled Grove , West Lake Axewell , South Lake Miloch , Bridge Field , Lake of Outrage , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Route 5 , Motostoke Riverbank , Stony Wilderness Rolling Fields , Dappled Grove , West Lake Axewell , South Lake Miloch , Bridge Field , Lake of Outrage , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Giant's Bed , Old Cemetery , Giant's Foot , Frigid Sea , Three-Point Pass , Ballimere Lake

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Savanna Biome , Coastal Biome , Torchlit Labyrinth Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
